Creation.Stat Restrictions: Your Intelligence and Might must be at least 1.

~Proficiency in Arcane~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks related to magic (e.g. identifying spells, magic items or runes, knowledge about magic, etc).

~Proficiency in Athletics~.Effect: Add your Level to all Might Checks for using your physical strength (e.g. lifting, breaking by hand, etc).

~Proficiency in Intimidation~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks for intimidating non-player characters into changing their mind, submission, etc.

~Proficiency in Persuasion~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks for persuading people non-agressively (convincing them through dialogue).

Language: You speak Common and a number of languages of choice equal to your Intelligence, out of which one must be Draconic, the ancient language of dragons that relies on conveying powerful messages through short words, shouts and dragon breath.
Other: Dragonborn have tails, though you can choose not to have one.

~Draconic Ancestry~.Effect:
When creating your character, choose any element from Acid, Cold, Fire, Shock, Force, Poison and Necrotic.
That becomes your Dragonborn Element.
~Draconic Ancestry~.Notes: The color of your skin and scales as a Dragonborn should reflect the element you chose (e.g. Cold might be associated with white or blue Dragonborns).

~Dragonborn Resistance~.Effect: You take only 50% Damage from your Dragonborn Element type.

~Dragon's Breath~.Effect:
Breathe your Dragonborn Element in a 3x1 meter line.
Make an attack against all Units caught in your breath.
The attack deals 2d6 + your class's Main Stat damage of your Dragonborn Element (against their Defense).
~Dragon's Breath~.Upgrade: At Levels 3, 6 and 9, you get one extra use of Dragon's Breath per Long Rest (e.g. the Cooldown becomes 2 times / Long Rest, 3 times / Long Rest, etc).

Starting Abilities Description.Color and Element:
When you create your character, choose your Dragonborn's color/element combination.
Then, you will choose the shape you want to be able to breathe your element in.

Starting Abilities Description.Area Shapes:
If you are playing on a grid, check the Area Shapes section to see how the Cone will look.
Breath - Line can be centered with either the left or right or diagonal starting square directly in front of you (so it might be slightly to the left or slightly to the right).

~Breath - Cone~.Effect: Your Dragon's Breath now breathes in a 3 meter, 90* cone.

~Breath - Line~.Effect: Your Dragon's Breath now breathes in a 4x2 meter line.

~Breath - Blast~.Effect: Your Dragon's Breath now breathes on all creatures within 2 meters of you instead of a line.

Ability Choices Description: As a Dragonborn, you can choose how your Dragon's Breath has evolved.

~Second Skin~.Effect:
Choose one more color from Draconic Ancestry.
You also gain Dragonborn Resistance to that color's element.
You can freely change Dragon's Breath to that element.

~Forceful Breath~.Effect:
Instead of using Main Stat, your Dragon's Breath now deals 1d6 Damage (for a total of 3d6 Damage).
Also, all Units affected by Dragon's Breath must also make a Might Check or be pushed 3 meters away from you and be knocked Prone.
~Forceful Breath~.Notes: Knocking prone works on Large or larger Units, but not pushing.

~Breath Control~.Effect: You can use Dragon's Breath one extra time per Long Rest.

~Wingspan~.Upgrades: At Levels 3, 6 and 9, you get one extra use of Wingspan per Long Rest (e.g. the Cooldown becomes 2 times / Long Rest, 3 times / Long Rest, etc).
~Wingspan~.Notes: If you don't pick this Talent when you create your character, you can't pick this later.
